text: Bahadurgarh Fort is a historical fort, built in the year 1658 CE, by the Nawab Saif Khan, but the fort was restructured by Maharaja Karam Singh of the historical princely state of Patiala in 1837. == Design and architecture == The fort is built in an area of about 21 sq kilometers in a circular shape surrounded by two ramparts and moat. The fort was built in 1658 and later renovated between 1837 and 1845 in the cost of around 100,000 at that time. The fort was named after Guru Tegh Bahadur, the ninth Guru. == References == ==External links== Category:Forts in Punjab, India Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1845 Category:Sikh architecture
title: Bahadurgarh Fort
